subject: Philosophy
title: What Is Beauty?
description: A short lesson to help you apply What Is Beauty?.

hook.text: A sunset, a symphony, a face. We call them beautiful. But what exactly makes them so?

buildup.text: Plato said beauty is objective â€” a reflection of perfect Forms beyond the physical world.

discovery.text: Hume disagreed. Beauty is in the eye of the beholder. It's a feeling, not a fact.

twist.text: Yet people across cultures agree on much. Symmetry, harmony, and golden ratios keep appearing.

climax.text: Perhaps beauty is neither purely objective nor subjective. It lives between us and the world.

punchline.text: Beauty moves us. Why is still a mystery.
